citation.article-title: Deinococcus depolymerans sp. nov., a gamma- and UV-radiation-resistant bacterium, isolated from a naturally radioactive site
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Deinococcus depolymerans sp. nov.
Deinococcus depolymerans (de.po.ly′me.rans. N.L. v. depolymerare depolymerize; N.L. part. adj. depolymerans depolymerizing).
Cells are strictly aerobic, non-motile, non-spore-forming and Gram-reaction-positive rods (0.4–0.6×2–1.8 µm; sometimes elongated up to 3.2 µm), which grow singly or in pairs.
Forms red, circular colonies (2–4 mm in diameter) within 2 days of incubation at 30 °C on NA.
Growth occurs at 18–40 °C (optimum 30 °C), at pH 5–11 (optimum pH 7) and in 0–2 % (w/v) NaC1 (optimum 0.5 %).
Aesculin, casein, gelatin, starch, DNA and Tween 80 are hydrolysed but agar, cellulose and chitin are not.
Indole and hydrogen sulfide are not produced.
Tryptophan deaminase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase and urease activities are negative.
Glucose, mannose, N-acetylglucosamine, maltose, gluconate and malate are assimilated but arabinose, mannitol, capric acid, adipic acid, trisodium citrate and phenylacetic acid are not.
In the API 50 CH system, acid is produced from glycerol, galactose, glucose, aesculin, cellobiose, maltose, sucrose and turanose.
The polar lipids profile consists of three unidentified phosphoglycolipids, five unidentified glycolipids and seven unidentified lipids.
MK-8 is the predominant menaquinone and the major fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C15 : 1ω6c, C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and summed feature 3 (iso-C15 : 0 2-OH and/or C16 : 1ω7c).
The DNA G+C contents are 70.5–70.6 mol%.
The type strain, TDMA-24T ( = JCM 14369T = NBRC 102115T = CCUG 53609T), was isolated from a fresh water sample collected at Misasa, Tottori, Japan.
